intro: Pouzolzia sanguinea var. formosana, commonly known as the Formosan bloodvine, is a climbing shrub native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae and is characterized by its slender, woody stems and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in terminal inflorescences. Its fruit is a three-lobed capsule that splits open to release seeds. This species is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and rocky slopes.
